getPassName - Return a nice clean name for a pass.

This usually implemented in terms of the name that is registered by one of the Registration templates, but can be overloaded directly.

### PrintAsmMemoryOperand() {#ab403daa878bf1aea350776efb872eac1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SparcAsmPrinter::PrintAsmMemoryOperand (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42; MI, unsigned OpNo, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; ExtraCode, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; OS)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Print the specified operand of MI, an INLINEASM instruction, using the specified assembler variant as an address.

Targets should override this to format as appropriate. This method can return true if the operand is erroneous.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/sparc/sparcasmprinter-cpp/#l00064">64</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/sparc/sparcasmprinter-cpp">SparcAsmPrinter.cpp</a>.
